body:
That would be great! I am not a big fan of saving the settings in a shared parameter. Its important for the settings to be embedded in the model so the Slack settings can be set once per project and saved to the file. 

I don't have much experience with Extensible Storage, but I remember looking into it and thought that the data had to be assigned to an Element within the project, which didn't sound like what we would want to do.

I thought the same thing, but [Jeremy Tammik's post ](http://thebuildingcoder.typepad.com/blog/2016/04/named-guid-storage-for-project-identification.html) about a project GUID actually prompted me to mention it

My most recent commit seems to have this working, but I'd like to do some more testing...Here it is: djsiroky/Slackit@43c9b2660f2c8619252f71e9a52dec6d1f368f72

The Element it's assigned to is a DataStorage object which is made for storing data from the API. I've tested syncing between two separate locals and the settings carry over and are updated on open, after sync, and when you launch the settings window (this covers using Reload Latest when the settings in the DataStorage from the central are different but there isn't an event to otherwise trigger re-checking that data for changes)

Thanks! Added #4 . I did also notice an issue that Extensible Storage as we have i produces and error when updating the code to have additional settings, if that project file that already had settings in the first place; but that's a different issue.

So that can be resolved on the code side by generating a new GUID in [ExtensibleStorage.cs](https://github.com/pix3lot/Slackit/blob/master/SlackitRevit/ExtensibleStorage.cs) when the Schema changes (saved settings are added or removed).
Nice, that's what I was thinking. Glad you confirmed it!

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.io.path.gettemppath(v=vs.110).aspx

This should put it in a location that will work. I can implement this over the weekend.
Great, much better,

It looks like the original Debug files weren't being included. So you likely were not getting the right files. I added a zip file to the Repo that has just the files you need. 

Unblock the zip, then extract the files to:
C:\ProgramData\Autodesk\Revit\Addins\2015
[SlackItRevit.zip](https://github.com/pix3lot/Slackit/blob/master/SlackItRevit.zip)

Let me know if that works.

Thank you. But it still doesn't work. Below is the warning information.  
![slackit screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20732036/17385170/ca6ac0ec-5995-11e6-9d03-307a8b1c7f92.jpg)

The reference to a DLL isn't correct, or reading.

What version of Revit are you installing it to? The Zip, as is, only works with Revit 2015 and not Revit Architecture, or a discipline specific version of Revit.

And definitely make sure to unblock the Zip before extracting.
Ha, it works! I think the problem is I didn't unblock the zip file. Thank you so much!
Glad we got it worked out!

I was looking into Option 2 earlier and if we can get that working fairly easily that seems to be the better   option. It seems cleaner and it makes it possible to use for discipline specific versions, like Revit Architecture, which has a different path to the references.

[This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JrrVZjy5pBE) was really clear about making these changes. I've created build configurations for 2015, 2016, and 2017. It handles the Revit.API and RevitAPI.dll references, as well as the references to images in `SlackRibbon.cs`.  

As for the `TransactionMode.Automatic`, the only 2 occurrences of that code was where no changes were being made to the Revit document (in `SlackRibbon.cs` and `EventsApplication.cs`) and therefore it was either unnecessary or could be changed to `TransactionMode.Manual`

Finally, changing the target .NET build did not cause issues with the 2015 version. I need to do further testing with the 2016 and 2017 versions before making a PR, but this should be done by the end of the week.
I meant to say that this issue is fixed with # #10
Did you have the messages enabled in the settings? Check the "Info" box next to "Worksharing"

Yes,
I tried it with many combinations.

Sent from my iPhone

> On Nov 28, 2016, at 2:45 PM, Ben Muller <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Did you have the messages enabled in the settings? Check the "Info" box next to "Worksharing"
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>

Its hard to tell what would be going on in your specific case. It should work with those options enabled. Before unzipping did you unblock the Zip file? If not, you can unblock the DLL files in the folder. If that's not the issue, are you able to debug and step through the code, then you would be able to tell where the issue is.

@pderooy @djsiroky I just noticed why this is happening. The issue is that you must have at least one pinned element for the notifications to work. This is an issue we need to fix in the code, but pinning one element in Revit will work around the issue for now.
I will download the new one, but the null in _start_state caused the program to exit out and not send the payload to slack.

Ah, you're absolutely correct. _start_state is initially set here: https://github.com/pix3lot/Slackit/blob/master/SlackitRevit/EventsApplication.cs#L226 but that's not always hit (for example, if Slack is not enabled when the document is opened), which would mean it's still null and cause the problems you're seeing.

It may be as simple as moving it up to around lines 49-77, so that initiate snapshot is always taken, even if it's not used. But I'll also look into better error handling in the ReportDifferences method.

Hi @aajameschung,

Can you click the "Show details" down arrow on the dialog you included and show us what it says there?

Also, did you install SlackIt using the files from the SlackItRevit.zip file? I can't be sure, but the files in the zip file may be for Revit 2015 only, and therefore is looking for Revit 2015's API files. If Revit 2015 isn't installed, it can't find them and gives you the error you see above. 

We do have the ability to build different versions of Revit (2015-2017, but 2018 shouldn't be difficult to add) that reference the proper version's API files, so I think it's a matter of adding different zip files for each version.

Thanks for the quick response. Here's the requested details:

![slackit error expanded](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30355499/28542428-1649f26a-708a-11e7-93b8-3b0dc5b5c10a.png)

And yes, we installed it from the Revit zip file. It mentioned 2015 specifically, but when we found it worked, we moved those files into the other version add-in folders and found it worked too. However, we had all versions installed. Then on some project teams, those teams only had their project-specific version installed, which is when we realized the error occurred.

The issue is as @djsiroky mentioned, the files in the original zip were compiled to reference the Revit 2015 API and so without it the plugin failed. 

I added four zips to the repository for versions 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 and updated the Readme. Download the one you need and give it a go.

Great, really appreciate it.

Thanks again for all your efforts on this, very helpful tool.

Hi @helenaqr, I followed the same steps as you and got the same problem. So I went ahead and rebuilt the zip folders and opened a pull request. If you'd like to try before the changes are brought it, you can download the 2016 zip file [from here](https://github.com/djsiroky/Slackit/blob/1c518445708db508508e93d0e47c4a70ce2a7168/SlackIt-2016.zip). Otherwise you can download it from here, once it is merged!

Thanks,
Dan
@djsiroky thanks for the update!
I uploaded a [2019 Version ](https://github.com/pix3lot/Slackit/blob/master/SlackIt-2019.zip) and updated the solution to include a 2019 configuration.
